title: How much money do book editors make per book? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on length, difficulty, specialization, and skill. I’ve seen editors that will do a whole 30,000 word book for $1500, and others who edit a book for more like $15,000 or more. (I’m at the higher end.) How do you get that high end? Specialize. Medical books. Business books. Historical fiction.Do the hard projects where authors need a lot of help.Develop a reputation by doing miracles for the authors you serve. Generate word of mouth.Pick rich clients who expect to make a big impression with the book.

It varies on word count/page count. A 100K novel comes in around 300 pages. At my rate of $12/1K words, I’d make $1,200 on the project. I’d need to ask $4/page to make the same, or roughly $0.01/word. Some editors ask $0.02/word. Some charge between $2-$5/page. Others have higher (or lower) rates per 1K words.
